33 
34 import random
35 from collections import deque
36 
37 class Oracle(object):
38  """
39  An example python library within a ROS package.
40 
41  The oracle class is a small wrapper for a random number generator.
42  """
43 
44  def __init__(self, seed=42):
45  self.initial_seed = seed
46  self.seeds = {seed}
47  self.rand = random.Random()
48  self.rand.seed(seed)
49 
50  self.last_predictions = deque(maxlen=30)
51 
52  self.predictor = self.getSampleEven
53 
54  def feed(self, seed):
55  """
56  Provide new inspiration for the oracle.
57  :param seed: integer number used to seed the random number generator
58  :return:
59  """
60  if not isinstance(seed, int):
61  raise TypeError("The oracle eats only integers.")
62  if seed in self.seeds:
63  raise ValueError("The oracle doesn't accept old seeds.")
64  self.rand.seed(seed)
65  self.seeds.add(seed)
66  return
67 
68  def setPredictor(self, model='even'):
69  """
70  Setting the model the oracle uses.
71  :param model: string specifying the model. Can be 'even' or 'gauss'
72  :return:
73  """
74  if model == 'even':
75  self.predictor = self.getSampleEven
76  if model == 'gauss':
77  self.predictor = self.getSampleGauss
78 
79  def getPrediction(self, arg1, arg2):
80  self.last_predictions.append(self.predictor(arg1, arg2))
81  return self.last_predictions[-1]
82 
83  def getSampleGauss(self, mu, sigma):
84  return self.rand.gauss(mu, sigma)
85 
86  def getSampleEven(self, min, max):
87  """
88  Returns a random value between min and max. If min > max, the values will be swapped.
89  :param min: lower border of selection interval
90  :param max: upper border of selection interval
91  :return: float sampled from an even distribution between min and max.
92  """
93  if not max > min:
94  min, max = max, min
95  delta = max - min
96  return self.rand.random() * delta + min
97 
98  def reset(self):
99  """Resets the Oracle to the state of the creation."""
100  self.seeds = {self.initial_seed}
101  self.rand.seed(self.initial_seed)
